DwGI3ipNSLq5vyBQQukFzw.text: Very friendly on my first visit not knowing how or what to order. Clean facility. The food is delicious and the salmon so tender. I got two meals out of one w the large portion. Definitely will go back!

_5Zs0-V84QPTeNOVnsDEvw.text: Pittsburgh Poke was awesome overall, except for the styrofoam containers. PLEASE switch to paper plates for customers that are dining in.   Food was good though. I loved the House Burrito #2. Very filling and good price. Everyone that works there is very nice too. The hype is real. Check it out.

ZC03sB2NV3PNhG-f_A8BeA.text: Got a bowl with brown rice, salmon and chicken, with all the fixings pretty much. SO GOOD! Can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Cq7q8K6NOE1aPqsTnxplzA.text: I was SO excited to hear that Pittsburgh Poke opened downtown! I'm always on the search for healthy options, and I tend to lean toward Asian cuisines, and I LOVE sushi. The restaurant is located where "Irrawaddy" (another Asian food place) was. I don't know if it's the same owners or someone new, but I also like Irrawaddy and hoped Poke would be just as good, if not better.  And it was!  I opted for a Poke bowl, custom, as opposed to one of the ones on their menu. The place works very much like Hello Bistro, but with raw fish options and add-ons that are associated with Asian food. I was in food heaven...just looking at the options in front of me had my mouth watering. I started with a base of quinoa and mixed greens. (The greens are actually greens, and not ice burg crap lettuce. Bonus!) You get 2 proteins - I chose tuna and salmon. My mix-ins included scallions, carrots, cucumber, kale, and radishes. My toppings included sesame seeds, tempura flake, and seaweed salad.  When it came time to put things together, I was a little confused about how and why they assemble the way they do. The lettuce and quinoa and lettuce went down first in the to-go bowl and it was a good portion. Then into a separate metal bowl, the proteins and *some* of the "mix-ins" went. I chose a combination of sauces - their house poke sauce and the spicy miso sauce. They ladled the sauces into the metal bowl and sorta mixed it, then put the contents of the metal bowl on top of the greens and quinoa, then added the "toppings." Immediately my thought was "great, the top half of the bowl will be awesome, and I'll be stuck with dry greens and quinoa."  And, disappointingly, that's exactly what happened. I don't really get the rhyme or reason behind this unusual assembly. Why not sauce the entire bowl, instead of mixing it in with only the contents of the metal bowl. It was odd and I ended up flipping the whole thing out of the bowl it came in so that I could cut up the lettuce and try to distribute the sauce a bit more. Next time, I will request sauce on the base AND on the stuff in the metal bowl so that it distributes better.  That's really the only sort of negative thing I have to say, though! The staff was friendly and smiley, the food was fresh and delicious and I will most definitely be going back! Great value, too!

l1_lwLe1V3w2OM7m_ztXvQ.text: Huge amount of fish for the price,  more than any sushi place downtown. I love the entire concept and they are extremely fast here! Lines move quickly and staff is friendly.  I would recommend getting sauce on the side. The first time i came here and found it overwhelming and couldn't taste anything except sauce.

sJX3RfNLGGpxldzcvRSBuQ.text: First off, I have to give these folks *major* props for even attempting poke service in Pittsburgh. Second, I fully recognize that we're never going to have a Suisan's (or even a KTA deli counter) on the banks of the Mon. Third, the "house poke sauce" is a reasonable facsimile of a classic shoyu poke dressing you might find in the 808 area code.  Nonetheless, my old friends back in Hilo and Waipahu would never call what they serve here "poke" -- whatever else it might be. Tasty (if ingredients are chosen with care)? Yes. Pretty good value? Yes. Reasonably healthy lunch alternative? Yes. But poke? Sorry, not even close.  Here are a few relatively cheap & easy suggestions for the management: (A) offer crunchy ogo seaweed as a topping -- with all the Asian restaurants and markets in the area, it's got to be readily available (daikon radish & kimchi would be welcome additions, too); (B) consider adding lomi lomi salmon (a simple chopped salmon salad with tomato, green & white onion, and salt) to the menu as a side dish (C) rethink the "spicy tuna" prep method, which currently reduces this noble fish to a pinkish-orange paste (is that really tuna?); (D) consider adding some daily specials to the fish line-up, along with the ahi (yellowfin) tuna and salmon -- like aku (skipjack) tuna, swordfish or tako (octopus); (E) pump in some Hawaiian music standards (e.g., Iz Kamakawiwo'ole, Gabby or Cyril Pahinui, Ka'au Crater Boys, Keola Beamer, etc.) to brighten up the spartan atmosphere and modulate the roar of the open cooler.  Congratulations on a brave effort to bring this glorious, fresh taste of the Pacific to dahntahn Pixburg, & `at. Here's hoping it's a little closer to the real thing on my next visit!

n7MrK5pwTuaRswgRKSi9jw.text: Pittsburgh Poke is a strong new downtown lunch option. Highlights include fresh food, great variety of toppings, easy-to-follow format, quick service, and friendly staff. I recommend giving it a try. I'll be back for sure.

e7r41dBt48oEFku86PpJYg.text: This place is amazing!! Not a ton of sushi options downtown Pittsburgh, so this is a god-sent! Lots of ingredients, sauces and meat/fish options to choose from, and everything tasted fresh. For two choices of meat/fish for 10.99, I think that is a pretty good deal. Line was quite long around 12 pm, but once I got up to the line, it moved very fast. Definitely will be coming back here for many more lunches!

kvvk2MVXHVK5oeQScvN6nQ.text: BEST Poke I'be had since I moved to the mainland! Wished I lived closer, I'd eat here every day!!

_OiejLgGwviBLc6p8qSxzg.text: I never write reviews but i desperately want this place to succeed. Top notch ingredients, a really good value (no nickel and diming), and quick service. Easily one of my top three lunch choices downtown. If you haven't been and you're looking to mix it up in terms of lunch options, you owe it to yourself to try this place.   Favorites fixings - salmon, spicy tuna, wakame (seaweed salad), ikura and masago. And go with the house poke sauce plus pickled radish and jalapenos.

msR5V3rMnZESs4vaCNXkIg.text: Favorite sushi place. Everyone is so nice and the food is fresh. Less than $12 for a LOT of food. Sushi burrito is the best!!!

KnlO9RReBZwWKeXOdwLQ8w.text: I was looking for something different. Not another sandwich, or pizza. Something healthy not a salad. I found this place on Yelp, and it was close to the Wyndham hotel next to McDonalds. I was a bit skeptical as I've only had poke in Hawaii.  I was absolutely blown away with the quality and quantity of ingredients. Everything was super fresh and tasty. I had a bowl with brown rice, spicy tuna, seared salmon, avocado, cucumbers, green onions, kale, cabbage, edamame, house poke sauce and spicy mayo. Wow, it was delicious! You should definitely check this place out!

8vxzkJEOZ3Ddo-2xN5Y2sA.text: Sushi burritos are literally the best thing to ever happen to me, and this place is the key to my sushi heart. Looks like a little hole in the wall place, but you will be pleasantly surprised!!!

CjWnqq1zKue9IoRL5M8bcQ.text: Hands down best poke spot I've ever. been. to. So many toppings!!! Fresh fish & pleasant staff. Can't wait to come back here next time I'm in Pittsburgh.

k1_yVzWQjHokOcPw2fxQBA.text: I'll start out by reminding everyone, including myself, that this is Pittsburgh. It's not California, and it's definitely not Hawaii. If you keep that thought in your head, then this place is a fine option in the Downtown area. It's not amazing. It's not horrible. It's fine. The fish is fresh, and the options to build your own poke bowl are sufficient.   What keeps this place from being amazing is the fact that this isn't the poke you can find on the West Coast or the Hawaiian islands. If you've had poke in either of those places before and think this is what you're going to get, you'll be disappointed. That said, if you go into the restaurant not expecting greatness, then you'll be fine.

E8WYphlV6MtZaxmn6dBqJw.text: Excellent lunch spot, Great quality reasonable price.  Had the salmon and Tuna poke bowl.  Easy to walk to market square tables if you want to sit outside.  Recommended!

8RpzS0gwhG_Rlroz6k1Ysg.text: I love Poke and frequently make my own at home, so I was pretty excited to hear this was opening in Market Square. Poke is becoming more mainstream on menus but typically the portion is tiny and leaves me still wanting something else afterwards. I ordered a Poke Bowl with tuna, salmon, quinoa, poke sauce, spicy mayo, sesame seeds, jalapeno, and some other toppings. It was very tasty and filling! I hope they do well in this spot and plan to frequent this location.

rSXwcqZaw3E6YfJvt82XKA.text: The bowl I got was delicious. It's a bit pricey for lunch, but still doable.

G3mjfDFxYM1IFzTyO7yxrw.text: Typically I like this place but they need to work on their portions. When they gave me a tiny bit of seaweed salad, I asked for more and they tried to charge me extra. It's already overpriced to being with, which I pay happily, and this has never happened to me before. Usually the helpings are bigger or they're happy to add some extra on. May want to rethink that Pittsburgh Poke!

vzdOn4PklHp5vXYFdZ5geg.text: this place is truly a gem and i'm so thankful for it! fair price for what you get. everything seems fresh, people are very friendly.

hRvuFZR4ItUzbReE9ZjWFg.text: I really enjoy Pittsburgh Poke! As other reviews have said, don't let the weird exterior fool you. At first glance, I never would have stopped by in a million years - but fortunately word of mouth travels fast when it comes to food and lots of friends have had great things to say about the place so I stopped in for lunch one day. $11-$13 may be more than what some are willing to pay for lunch, but I personally think that what you get for the price is worth it! Even with the lower-priced option you get your choice of two proteins, and unlimited toppings come without an upcharge. Avocado in fact, is not extra.  My typical bowl starts with a salad base, shrimp and spicy tuna, and a mix of different toppings with a bit of spicy mayo and the poke sauce. Everything is so fresh and don't be deterred by the long line. They move people through fast!

7gpc0wUTwrxXMc8CRq-cfA.text: I was so surprised to see a poke place when I had a Pittsburgh layover, and it exceeded my expectations for east coast poke.    The portion is HUGE for what you pay. They have so many topping selections and the ingredients seem quite fresh and flavorful.   It looks like a hole in the wall from the outside but please don't let that deter you! It's fast, healthy, and delicious! The staff is also super friendly.

dPcOSKw_m9ykL2H72ZHZ9A.text: I absolutely loved this place and can't wait to go back! What a great idea!  Think Salad Bar, but Sushi. You have the option of either doing a Sushi Bowl or Sushi Burrito. I went for the bowl, my fiance had the burrito and we both were very happy with our choices. You pick a base of either white or brown rice (or the option of greens for a bowl), then you pick your protein, toppings, sauces and voila--a sushi bowl. I went for white rice, raw tuna and salmon, topped with a few veggies and a ginger vinaigrette sauce with some sesame seeds and it was delicious!   I had a bite of a sushi burrito and am definitely going to try that next time. I was worried it would be hard to eat or fall apart, but the rice was sticky enough and the seaweed wrap big enough to hold it all in.   The staff was very friendly and the service was great. Delicious, filling lunch or dinner option downtown for just around $10!

LxH1BTC35tsLz-U_Oxy-Vw.text: Stopped in today to get some takeout poke. I ordered their House Bowl 1. I want to start by mentioning that this is one of the hottest days of the summer so far and this place had no AC. Standing in line watching them prepare my food I began to feel unsettled by how hot it was inside--considering the raw fish sitting out--even though they were in cold holding. After receiving my bowl I was a little disappointed at the quantity of almost every ingredient. Compared to other poke places in Pittsburgh, who also serve high quality fish, this bowl came up short. The price was on par with most other local sushi places, but I could help but wish there was more protein for the price. The staff was very friendly even though they were very busy. Overall the flavor of the poke was ok aside from the few pieces of tuna I got which tasted old. I recommend you check out other poke places in Pittsburgh before this one.

7mtap5QTq5oyl7uE6NaRUg.text: Great poke, nice service. Good portions. Bringing poke to Pittsburgh, wish them good luck!

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Poke bowl 2 and burrito 2. Delicious!

U_lEIvfSe_sgnf7GEhWIUg.text: This place is simply amazing! Finally a poke place in Pittsburgh offering sushirritos!! Food is super fresh and lots of choices for protein, veggies and sauces.  Best part is you get unlimited numbers of selections without additional charge, including avocado. Get there early for lunch because the line will be out the door by 12:30.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushirrito!

esG_PNV0DyvhcAOtysHAIg.text: Pittsburgh 10000% needed somewhere like this.  I've been wanting to stop in forever and I finally had the chance to last week. My first time was so amazing I came back the very next day for more.  As others have mentioned, it doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is clean and bright. During both visits, staff behind the counter have been extremely helpful.  The assortment of toppings is fresh and tasty!  I got the double protein version of the bowl - first seared tuna and crab salad, then the raw tuna and salmon.  I added allllll the toppings and sauces.  There are endless combinations you can create, or you can order off of their menu where they've created some of their own.  Portions are generous for the price and you can choose 2-3 proteins and as many toppings/sauces as they have available.  This will become one of my dinnertime staples. Definitely a cool little place to check out!

jSN-IByUCqVLP1fxq8TrLw.text: Such an amazing addition to the downtown lunch scene. Service is fast, workers are so kind, and the food is fresh as can be. Only downfall is expect to spend about $12 on lunch. You have the option of ordering either a sushi burrito, or bowl. They have traditional sticky white rice, or you can sub sticky brown rice, quinoa, and I've also seen people building salads. They charge by either one protein or two, best to get two if you want the burrito or bowl to be fully loaded. The tofu is steamed and very fresh. The toppings are endless and they don't nitpick you by how many toppings, you can choose as many as you'd like. They have "crunchy" toppings as well, add-ons to make it spicy, and a variety of house-made sauces. Been here twice so far and it was fabulous both times. I prefer the bowl as I feel you get a more balanced meal with all the toppings/add-ins as opposed to the burrito. My friend liked the burrito better with the quinoa vs. the rice, as the rice was heavy/a lot and the add-ins get a little lost with all the rice. They also have some pre-made sushi in the fridge to grab and go, as well as several drinks. The tofu bowl is their vegan option and all their sauces (minus the eel) are vegan friendly. So, so delicious! I just think the tofu should be priced differently (cheaper) than all the raw fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tofu bowl with brown rice and unlimited toppings.  So so fresh, perfect lunch spot
Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brown rice sushi burrito with tofu

szRIRnwPNhfeDxM-n0Ix6g.text: I tried the sushi burrito which is basically a very large roll and you get to pick your ingredients. I chose off of the menu they have a special role that has already preset ingredients, it was fantastic.  It was about $11 and is enough for one large meal or two small meals depending on your appetite. The staff was great.  This place is delicious and I recommended highly.  Most importantly it did not make me sick.

9FQMbw53Ofy0Im-zjDkaCQ.text: Excellent poke.   Got the triple tuna bowl with brown rice and veggies.  Very good and (another post complained of small portions?) quite a bit of poke for the $. Not much of a restaurant to look at but it was very clean. One comment is to get real bowls and ditch all the plastic ware for eat-in diners. Save the planet one plastic fork and knife at a time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

sA2eHQAJ9qkIxWS679nwMw.text: I came across Pittsburgh Poke while browsing Yelp to find a place for lunch and I recently have fallen in love with Poke so was excited to find this place. The reviews seemed to be promising too! I convinced my friend to go with me and it was super hard to find at first because it's so tiny, but I'm so glad I found it. It was not busy at all when I went, which is a bonus for me! I loved that they do have the create your own option or the house creations! It was delicious! Everything tasted fresh and ripe! My friend that went with me isn't big into this type of food, but she even enjoyed hers! The portions are great and no matter how many ingredient I asked for they didn't rip me off with the amount they put in. Definitely recommend checking this place out! Wish I lived in Pittsburgh so I could frequent it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

d6Eu8qk9yDSjbcyZzbN_ZA.text: With Pittsburgh being such a big foot city it's hard to come up with a concept that hasn't already been done before but Pittsburgh Poke did just that. For those that don't know what it is, the best way of describing it is a chipotle setup but with poke bowls/burritos. You walk in and you have the option of choosing one of their pre selected bowls/burritos or you have the option to build your own. You choose a base, protein, toppings, and sauce. I was a little hesitant, as I think most downtown employees were, because most residents before Pittsburgh Poke haven't always been the greatest establishments and they never last long. A lot of my coworkers have tried it since it's opening and all of them have agreed that it was very good and much better then they expected. I hope that means that Pittsburgh Poke will stick around a little longer then the previous tenants! I know I will definitely be going back many times because that house poke sauce is just so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

JsUZWMMm60lQ4Rcgz0QVkQ.text: Grand opening and it is yummy! Portions aren't huge but on par with standard Japanese fare. They have takeaway sushi and buffet style Thai too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

1sdyL0ONsPhSB8sDFu6ufA.text: I have been wanting to try Pittsburgh poke, but I was never able to find a parking spot. It's located on liberty avenue downtown right around the corner from market square which is pretty busy at lunchtime and it was about 12:00. So I see a spot open and head in this sketchy ass building meanwhile I'm keeping an open mind because the dive bars and little dirty looking restaurants often have really good food. I get inside and it's set up with all the ingredients looking like a jail cafeteria with inmates working lol but honestly it wasn't too bad. It was a nice price $11.95 for a bowl with spicy tuna, krab salad (with a k lol) and some toppings. Pretty basic flavors I would maybe go back if I was downtown close by but nothing I would travel for. I would rather have kahuna in east liberty or hidden harbor in squirrel hill. If I wasn't starving I probably wouldn't have finished it. I would have given 2.5 stars if I had the option but not 3

h2C9JLCgkorV2BP4yIpdWg.text: Ordered via postmates and added additional veggies and things to my bowl via the comments section! Super delicious and will be ordering again soon!

NH4smVOd7FCwyGvOT5mSjA.text: Exceeded my expectations! So flavorful but not overbearing & all the ingredients were so fresh. Probably the best poke bowl I've had in a while, & I've tried many! Oh & the staff was also very friendly, definitely coming back when I'm in town again :)

a78uZQ7pL-wxTRb9_7TB-w.text: So excited that Pittsburgh finally has a decent poke and sushi burrito place! Even better that it's close to my work! This place is AMAZING! I have yet to try the sushi burrito because I love the bowls so much, but it's on my list. For those that don't know what poke is, think Chipotle but with sushi.  I've gotten a few bowls from this place already, all have been really good and really fresh. I love that they have brown rice and quinoa as options as well, instead of just white rice. I normally order salmon, tuna, brown rice, with a bunch of veggies, and the citrus ponzu sauce. The citrus ponzu sauce is very fresh tasting, not too sweet. The bowls are a decent size.   The lines can get long during the lunch rush hour, but the past couple times I have gone the wait has been short. They also have premade to-go sushi, which I haven't tried yet but looks yummy. I consider the bowls to be a better value than sushi rolls, since they are more filling and you can customize them exactly how you want. They also have some pre-made recipe options for you to pick from.  Staff is super nice. Love this new addition to downtown Pittsburgh!

EcZCj5xhBtl_-5yNaSn5rQ.text: Love their poke bowls and sushi burritos! Price is reasonable too. I can have them every week!  Friendly people too.  Parking isn't easy though and there's not a lot of choices for my kids.

pYaJ4PUYUjkDEeFB8ej4Nw.text: Got a sushi burrito with Shrimp, cucumber, avocado, cilantro and honey sesame sauce. It was dreamy,

3ctI-WMs9KARzilrJBRwHg.text: I went to Pittsburgh Poke yesterday for lunch. I previously saw a sign for this place last week when I was driving home from work. It originally said it would be opening on June 23rd, but when I went last Friday, they changed the open date to June 26th. What caught my eye is that the main items they offer are sushi burritos and poke bowls! These are two things that are not really available to Pittsburgh at this current time, especially downtown! When I walked in, I was greeted by a man who handed me a menu. The place is small but roomy and there are a few tables for dining in. I walked up to the counter and it is basically set up like Chipotle, but with sushi ingredients. You have the option to make your own sushi burrito or poke bowl, or to order any 4 of their house burritos and bowls. I decided to make a poke bowl. You start with a base. I choose the half & half option of half white rice and half organic mixed greens. Then you can choose your protein. You can do two or three choices or do double or triple protein or one item. I chose salmon and spicy tuna. (Note:they offer both raw and cooked options -- they also offer tofu). Next, you can chose your mix-ins. They offer options like mango, avocado, jalepeno and cilantro. Then you choose your sauces-- options like house poke (it's a sweet vinegar) I tried it and it was delicious. Other sauce options are spicy mayo, eel sauce, sweet wasabi and ginger sesame. Lastly you can choose the flavorful toppings. Choices such as pickled ginger, masago, seaweed salad, and nori flakes. They carefully layered and packaged up my poke bowl. Everything is half off this week as it is their opening week.   My poke bowl was seriously amazing. They can take all of my money now! lol I will definitely be back sometime this week!  *note: they also offer pre packaged sushi and a small Thai hot foods bar. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and explained what everything was.  I am so happy that Pittsburgh Poke is here!

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Back of menu!
Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Create your own menu
Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My poke bowl!

3U1vswMpRt_CY9DxNkHgmQ.text: This restaurant seemed more upscale than it really is.  The food was delicious, fast  and fresh. But, there is little more. I asked for a cup with ice, but they had no ice and only a limited variety of drinks. My wife noticed some black fragments of lettuce on the leaves that I thought was a really minor issue, but it and the general cheap ambiance pretty much turned her off. You really can build your own poke bowl from quite a number of ingredients for less than 13 dollars plus tax and the raw tuna and salmon was ample. We walked about 20 pleasant minutes from the Homewood Suites. Watch out for poor Google navigation--the address works better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. What the wife saw
Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House Bowl 2.

QcyhOjoG5cu8mDX6TP3YOw.text: Tried this during their opening week and cannot wait to go back.    I had a fairly traditional poke bowl. White sticky rice, raw tuna, onions, scallions, poke sauce, a little avocado and then topped with spicy mayo and some fried onions for crisp.  The tuna was very fresh as were the rest of the ingredients.   I look forward to going back and trying more of their offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuna poke bowl with avocado, onions, spicy mayo, and topped with fried onions for some crunch.

EAo92QFQmq7S05BhLviUdQ.text: Love poke and I am glad that Pittsburgh finally got their act together and opened a poke place.   Pittsburgh poke is not a fancy place.  The decor is boring and plain and the service kind of matches.  That said, it's reasonably priced and the food is worth it.  It's not "great", but it is definitely better than good.     They have a few house bowl and burrito options, but the appeal is the make your own.  Their menu has options without being completely overwhelming, which I appreciate.  The fish is fresh and tasty.  While maybe not the finest quality I have ever had, it is plenty good and fresh.  I am calorie counting at the moment and while they don't post nutrition values, it was easy enough to get a satisfying meal that wasn't crazy terrible for me.  Overall, I would definitely return.

22DYcUngn_v4-ohTM0ylxg.text: Went there for the first time a week ago; glad there's finally a poke place in Pittsburgh! I went around 4/5pm and it wasn't crowded, but I hear that it's a lot busier during lunch. It used to be a different Asian restaurant (which was also good the last time I went), but the owner converted the place to become Pittsburgh Poke.  This was my first time trying poke, so I wasn't sure what to add in my bowl, but they have basic house bowl options for you to choose from that have great combinations. I got the house bowl 1, which was pretty filling but somewhat pricey. I thought it was one the best ways to eat sushi, especially because the flavors are more distinct, with bigger pieces of fish than in normal sushi.  It seemed like they were still getting things in order - AC was broken, decor was simple, etc. However, the workers were very friendly and took great care to make sure everything was clean (they changed their gloves in front of you).  Overall, I don't think I would go there regularly (price), but it's a delicious and great place to try out!

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House Bowl 1

KScKtC4lcuSaWqKV7O3CIw.text: Great lunch place! Delicious, fresh, and quick - once it was my turn in line - this place seemed popular! I got the house bowl #1. Great mix of salmon and tuna with mango and the other fixings. I'd recommend it!

em6Bx3cH9In0pn06t0Cs5g.text: Probably my favorite place in downtown Pittsburgh.  Definitely my favorite quick serve option. The concept is similar to a chipotle or moe's.  You order your entree in either a bowl or burrito and then choose your ingredients.  Two meats/proteins brings your total to just over $11 and choosing three around $13.  I almost always choose two scoops of spicy tuna (but have also tried shrimp and crab).  You pick your base (brown or white rice, quinoa or lettuce) and then your main toppings.  There is a fairly large number of options available.  Some of my favorites are cucumber, avocado and mango.  You also choose your sauce (I get the poke sauce and ask for extra.  It is filled with flavor and has a little kick) and then pick your toppers (things like ginger, seaweed salad, sesame seeds and edamame).  The whole process takes less then five minutes and you have a tasty, fresh and customized meal.  I find them to be filling and satisfying. The staff speaks limited English, but they know enough to walk you through your order. If you are downtown Pittsburgh I highly recommend giving them a try.

clPA5zrh1yxMpbR_mAgcWQ.text: Built my own Poke Bowl with white rice, salmon, spicy tuna, cucumbers, spicy mayo and sesame seeds. It turned out to be quite fantastic. I do recommend this place if you're looking for a quick bite to eat.

The portion was large and all the vegetables are fresh. I got a customized poke bowl, my friend got a sushi burrito. We both enjoyed it very much. c7GQq8CHdgTUN1S88hnYcA.text: The track record of restaurants in this space have not been good.  It's an awkward front on an extremely busy intersection that has devoured attempts at peruvian chicken, sushi, and thai.  The only constant seems to have been vacancy similar to it's old neighboring Wendy's or the ability to purchase a happy meal with a crack / heroin / pill surprise at the adjacent McDonald's.  Needless to say, there is a lot working against anyone trying to establish a respectable business here.  Fortunately one way to make a name for yourself is to provide consistent quality and great tasting food, both of which have been the case throughout three separate visits since opening. I have not had the pleasure of experiencing authentic poke on any of the Hawaiian islands, nor the pacific coast, so perhaps any following commentary is off base in that regard.  What I can say is that the food is fresh, the options are plentiful and mindful, and the service and process are relatively quick.  Having played with a few combinations on previous trips, I was able to approach lunch with a more cohesive game plan that culminated in a very flavorful and satisfying result.  A sticky white rice base, half portions of spicy and seared tuna, avocado, cucumber, jalapeno, cilantro, scallion, shaved red cabbage, pickled daikon, crispy onions, toasted sesame, chili flake, spicy mayo, house poke sauce, pickled ginger, and seaweed salad.  Unfortunately the spicy tuna doesn't seem to be much more than a coating of sriracha, currently the world's most overhyped condiment, but it was enough flavor to balance the freshness and slightly tart pickle of the other elements.  This approach yielded a very successful textural contrast and a great harmony of flavors.  This is still a new business and there are a few kinks to work out, particularly the lack of AC supplemented by a couple industrial fans blowing in the direction of the queue (not a great mental image, being a concept that primarily serves raw fish that is nowhere near the waters they originated), but it's close.  Poke is a great option in the Market Square food landscape that provides great quality similar to it's rolled counterpart two blocks over at Number 1 Sushi. Pittsburgh may not be synonymous with Hawaiian cuisine, but if the simplistic nature is maintained and the product remains fresh, there is no reason why this can't start to turn that particular corner of downtown.

XAQ7mWfKhuLYVpzKNPP4EA.text: Place looks a bit rough & low rent from the outside which can scare some people off when it comes to seafood but it's clean & delicious on the inside! This place is a must try!! (And inexpensive too!) My only recommendation is get extra protein. Will definitely be back when in town.

tvuUwKX82atZtEH6VcVljQ.text: I love that poke has made its way to Pittsburgh! While this definitely satisfied my craving, I was hoping for so much more! The service was good, but the atmosphere was not great. The building was dingy and a bit sketchy. I was a bit worried about the freshness of ingredients, but overall the food was okay.

63O415U5qlkY9MjWAExr7w.text: I got the House Bowl 1 here. The dining area feels a bit packed but the food is decent. Nice staff and plenty of topping choices for custom poke bowls. The salmon and tuna were fresh and diced in large cubes. Satisfying :D. $11 is within the reasonable price range as well.

LoQY1pfLESjELN_dZvRNyA.text: My new favorite spot in Pittsburgh. These guys hook you up. Be familiar with the menu options before coming in.

MJohqcBA0CTcBWmRFa7FCg.text: I'm so happy to have this place here.  I enjoy a good poke bowl, and this is the finest I've had so far inland.  The staff is super friendly and even when the line is long, it moves quickly.  You can go in and do your own creation, or choose from a couple of pre-conceived bowls or sushi burritos.  (So far I've only had bowls because I like them so darn much.) The restaurant space itself is pretty small, so if you want to dine in, go early to get one of the handful of tables.  It's very casual; drinks are in a cooler and flatware is all plastic.  So, I usually get the takeout option...also so I can bring it back into the office and make my coworkers jealous over my bomb poke bowl. ;-)

c7sAdJqvQuO2Kpjccmd16A.text: If you work downtown, I highly recommend checking out Pittsburgh Poke. This place doesn't appeal to the eye on the outside, but the food is delicious. I usually get a create-your-own bowl, which consists of rice, 2 meats/fish, endless toppings and fantastic sauces.   It's a little pricier than your typical on the go type spot, but given the amount of fresh quality food that you get with your order, it's totally worth it.

n0UgbUzL6jiUAtTB3vw8jg.text: Ordered delivery from here. I loved the make your own poke bowl. Delicious and fresh. Will definitely be ordering here again.

UImN2mCVPbBe0ZPz_gq1rQ.text: Poke finally comes to Pittsburgh ... a trend that seems to be hitting most U.S. cities like no other (not sure why). Anyways, came here as this was new at the time. Here are my impressions.  Decor/Ambiance: Interior is rather unimpressive. Essentially with some tables/chairs for seating, a condiments/sauce bar, and the ordering register/checkout area where you can order & add your extras. Reminds me of cafeteria-like set up, which I don't mind.  Food: Quite yummy. You can either create your own poke bowl or sushi burrito, choose your bases (quinoa +$1), proteins (2 - $10.99, 3 - $12.99), mix-ins, sauces, and toppings. There are also presets if you're too lazy to do so. Food here is great. Seafood used is fresh, mix-ins are fresh & diverse (love the variety), and sauces & toppings as well in regards to variety. Love the diverse customization you can do here with your order & at a most reasonable price as price points are relatively cheap compared to poke joints I've been to in other cities.  Overall, a most worthy poke joint to visit in order to satisfy your poke craving. Just be warned that parking can be a bit of a pain since it is downtown & meter maids are much more viligant about enforcing the limited street parking around this area.

xmtGcY_uSYGAIvTQ4_d1Gw.text: I love this place! They always have fresh fish and delicious toppings. We have been here a few times and each time the service is great. We have always come on the weekend so I don't know how busy they are during the week, but each time we've visited the place isn't very busy.  Pros: Fish is super fresh A ton of toppings available  A great amount of food for the price The sauces are delicious  You can get anything you want on the side (which I am a huge fan of) Service is great  Cons: There is no air conditioning or heat, so depending on the weather, it can be too hot or cold for a dine in meal The location is sort of obscure so if you don't know it's there you may miss it

RsIDSWW--SmHfNF0tzhQXw.text: This place is like a build your own poke bowl down to the sauce. There were so many choices and the staff here were super patient and kind. It's a breath of fresh air and very quick in service.

8_faeCpbFsR7W0WPsjQOhQ.text: I've stopped in here quite a few times now and I absolutely love it. Everything about Pittsburgh Poke is great! B42qe1shEOM9dL14tmVqow.text: Coming from Hawaii, poke is part of our staple. So tasting poke from other parts of the state is interest. For starters we came at 6p. It was empty and warm. The place closes at 7p. Now for the taste, it can be improve by adding more flavor. Just because it's raw fish doesn't make it an authentic dish from Hawaii. 2pwu7QGDt75qwmseTRQrNg.text: I have to admit I was a little taken aback by the outside appearance. This is a case of don't judge a book by its cover. Or the inside either... because it's pretty plain as well. Plus, the air wasn't working on a hot summer day, which doesn't bode well for fish. But I still tried it, so I guess I'm brave.  Regardless, the fish seemed fresh. It's on you to pick the toppings, so I'd suggest going crazy because they don't scoop a lot in your bowl with each topping. I like that they have a choice of brown rice. I also like that they have a variety of sauces to dress your bowl with... Big fan of sauces over here!  It was fairly quick service too. Just don't go in thinking this will be a hip and swanky eatery. It's literally a poor man's Chipotle, but with poke, and I'm okay with that!

zHD_o1OYjj72-iAj2k0Jkw.text: Finally, the poke craze comes to Pittsburgh. Although I've been dying for a poke restaurant to open up in town, I was initially skeptical about this place. I mean, fluorescent yellow paint is not exactly an appetizing color. However, once you get past the not-so-appealing exterior, you'll be pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food.  For anyone who doesn't know what poke is, basically, it's sushi in bowl form. If raw fish freaks you out, they serve chicken and tofu as well. The process is similar to a Chipotle setup where you choose your base, protein, and toppings as you go through the line. My usual bowl comes with the salad base, tofu, and literally every topping they have available (toppings are free!). Combine it with the spicy mayo and it is heaaaven. The line usually reaches the door during lunchtime, but they get everyone through at a fairly quick pace.  My only complaint would be the price point which is a bit high for fast casual and the portion size you get. A two protein bowl is $10.99 and a three protein bowl is $12.99.Perhaps it's my monstrous appetite or my black hole of a stomach, but I'm never exactly full whenever I finish my bowl. There are definitely better deals out there if you're in it for the quantity.

PxZOg8jWe5fuPVwyi4XlHA.text: Pretty... Pretty... Good!!  The interior decor may seem a bit worn, but the flavors and ingredients are cutting edge.  Just walk in, ask for your rice style, protein and toppings, and BOOM!!  Grab some chop sticks and go to town.  It's filling, tasty and healthy

ewb47kOVeIzs97Z3L6FrhQ.text: So grateful I found this place! Friendly staff and the freshest food! This place is definitely going to become one of my Togo lunch spots!   I recommend eel sauce and spicy mayo!!

hnpTECjq1r0FeJus0YbgWg.text: Coming to Pittsburgh from the west coast, I was hesitant when I first saw Pittsburgh Poke. It's in a very unassuming location by Market Square with just small signage in the windows and a banner above the door. Their prices are also humble and initially made me question whether the food would be any good. But I was completely wrong. I judged a book by its cover.   Pittsburgh Poke offers delicious fresh fish bowls (or burritos) with great chipotle like options for filling your bowl. These include free options such avocado, sriracha mayo, and cucumbers and a couple premium ones like salmon roe. Their prices are unbelievable considering the quality of the food. They don't skimp on portions either, I'm a big eater and getting three portions of fish (only $13) is enough for me to feel full.  TLDR: Fresh fish, great choices for filling your bowl, and unbeatable prices make Pittsburgh Poke an easy choice for lunch or a casual dinner downtown. Don't make the same mistake I did and judge it by it's exterior.

xmdQO54Ux8FYNVKL4PyCIg.text: If I were only reviewing the food I'd give 4 stars. It's very good and seems to be fresh. That said, the prices are outrageous! zCRZccylkMOmqmr_XBxGLw.text: On the outside it doesn't look like much and I probably would have walked right past it if it wasn't for all the hype. Prior to trying Pittsburgh Poke, I had a poke bowl from Tako ($14). Was it delicious? Yes. Was it worth the money? No. Takos bowl doesn't compare to the nice sized bowl Pittsburgh Poke gives you. Tako also doesn't have as many options as Pittsburgh Poke and options are what everyone wants.  Let's talk about the options Pittsburgh Poke has to offer. There are 9 protein options (choose 2 $10.99 or choose 3 $12.99).  There are 12 mix-in options and you can go all in with these because they are unlimited. There are 7 sauce options and 12 topping options. If you are an avocado fan, they're not going to charge you extra like most places do (cough cough Tako).   Since they opened in June I have came here 3 times. The first time I decided to build my own burrito. I kept it pretty simple - brown rice, avocado, mango, shrimp, spicy mayo and house poke sauce (on the sweet side). These burritos like the bowls are VERY filling. The other 2 times I wanted to build a bowl and this is when I decided to get creative. For the first bowl I went with brown rice, shrimp & kani salad (crab), cucumber, carrots, avocado, red cabbage, blanched kale, house poke, spicy mayo, sesame seeds & seaweed salad. The second bowl I went with brown rice, shrimp & seared tuna, cucumber, mango, red cabbage, avocado, carrots, house poke, spicy mayo, seaweed salad & sesame seeds. I also really like that they let you sample something before you make your selection. I was unsure of the seared tuna at first, but they are nice enough to let you try it before committing.   If you are looking for a sit down place to have lunch, this might not be the place for you due to very little seating. It is definitely perfect for on the go though!

eJuE-p9M9Z27nk1wAEUaMw.text: The bad: Some of the salmon chunks were straight up frozen. The rest of them had a slightly mushy texture and no flavor (probably from being frozen). I got salmon in the first place because the tuna looked grey and dull and sad, probably old.   The good: really good sauces and toppings.  Decent rice.   However, I can't give more than 1 star because the defining element of poke is the fish, and the fish here was by far the worst I've had out of dozens of poke places. I got my bowl to-go because I had to catch a bus, and wasn't able to go back to the restaurant by the time I had found the frozen fish. Disappointed and won't be coming back.

yq7AzclR__gVfQ4OGjBVsw.text: When you want actual real food then come here. Wanting something light after a sweat sesh, this place seemed like the obvious choice. I got the half brown rice and quinoa and half mixed greens which provided the perfect amount of carbs, nixed the fruit and kept the toppings veg. For protein, the ahi was surprisingly plentiful and so was the edamame! Instead of the usual 2, I'd recommend getting just 1 or half a serving of the dressing which was the perfect amount.

thngEfagCVXKGctxlpw6-Q.text: I could be wrong, but this is the only place that makes a Sushi Burrito that I know of in the general Pittsburgh area,...so I had to try it.  Not the nicest of storefronts, inside is cleaner but not beautiful. They definitely need to crank up the A/C in warm, humid July days.  The Sushi Burrito making process is simple. Pick your rice, proteins, veggies, sauces and other extras. Roll it up and enjoy.  I went with white rice with Shrimp and Spicy Tuna. Added only green onions and celery along with Spicy mayo. Finally added some tempura and wasabi/ginger on the side.  Basically, it's Sushi in Burrito form. Very good and filling.  The Sushi Poke bowls seem to be a big seller and there was always a line while I was there, but the wait is not long.  Looking forward to my next visit already!

TPwn-nu9icYrSvrwWo_Zvw.text: This is one my favorite places to get lunch in downtown Pittsburgh. I love burritos - I love sushi - so unsurprisingly, I love the sushi burritos here! I admittedly haven't been able to break my burrito addiction and order any actual poke bowls yet. Soon though!  This eatery may look plain and simple, but don't let that appearance fool you or scare you off. This place is home to some quality food, as well as very good staff who can keep a line moving and make you smile with their delicious creations. Although, I guess it's really YOUR creations, since you can pick what goes in your burrito or bowl!  Currently I usually order one of the pre-set menu options because it's a great combination (Spicy tuna, salmon, cucumber, avocado, spicy mayo wrapped in sushi rice, sesame seeds and nori.). But for those of you who want something more: the sushi burritos work the same as their poke bowls. You can choose a base (rice, greens, quinoa, or half & half), two or three proteins, plus your mix-ins and sauces. The staff will put your order together similar to a Chipotle ordering line, and you'll be ready to dine!  As others have mentioned, this place is small, so it's best to come early or to be ready to carry your food out to eat elsewhere. And if you're totally new to the poke/sushi burrito game, their four pre-set menu options can help you get familiar with the process and the flavors you can combine. So go forth and create your meals, my friends - and enjoy!

7SYZTIZPc5igI88y_uMaqA.text: Got lunch here today and it's awesome! So good and so many options. Great if you're trying to be healthy or if you just love sushi! So many different toppings , proteins , and bases. You can tell it's fresh which of course is important with food like this. The woman who served me was very sweet. Will definitely be back!

ued7na03FFwmQqJ1JJBYAA.text: Super yum!  Everything I wanted in a poke bowl. I arrived early evening on a weekday and there was no line. I was greeted by a very kind girl who explained to me the process. You start with your base. You can either get a bowl or burrito style. I decided to get my base with half brown rice and half lettuce. You can choose as many meats as you want. I did spicy tuna and salmon. There's also tons of toppings to choose from. They don't charge you extra for avocado and they give you such a generous amount of seafood and toppings. You can choose as many as you want and the portions are abundant. For the price, which I think I paid about $13, it was so worth it. It was a heavy bowl full of deliciousness. The customer service was great, the price was reasonable, the food was delicious, and I didn't even have to wait in line. Located in the center of downtown Pittsburgh near market Square, Pittsburgh Poke definitely a thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I want this right NOW!

bRHsL_wpA1fvy-pg-co1ow.text: Love love love!  I finally got to check out Pittsburgh Poke last night. Have you ever been to Chipotle?  Or Hello Bistro?  You essentially "design" what you eat...meet - Pittsburgh Poke  First start is a base - brown or white rice, quinoa (+$1), salad or half/half.  I went brown rice and quinoa.  (I personally love quinoa in my salads - so I bet it would be a great half/half with lettuce too!)  Side note: Doing the half/half gets you around the extra $1 for quinoa too!  Second stop - meat!  You get 2 choices for the $10.99 option.  Personally - that was PLENTY.  I chose to get 2 scoops of salmon - but they have alll kinds of choices (Salmon, tuna, spicy tuna, chicken, etc).    Third stop is mix ins - avocado, cucumber, carrot, etc.  They have a TON of great mix ins.  It seems that you could pick as many as you wanted.   Fourth - toppings/dressing - I got the ginger sesame.  I added some soy sauce as they don't give you a ton of sauce - so the little bit of extra soy sauce was helpful.  The only downfall was the air conditioner was broken.  You would think - raw fish...no air...should I be nervous?  Nope!  Their fish is fresh, phenomenal and tasty.  We didn't eat on site because of the air problem - but still quick service, phenomenal food, and quick and easy to go - all for $12 (a little more with tip!)    The only thing - I wish they were open a little later on week nights.  I get that lunch is their BIG crowd (understandably!)  But maybe on sport event nights and/or show nights - stay open a bit later than 7.  It's hard to get down there sometimes.  I definitely can not wait to go back.  Maybe a burrito next time.  It was SO good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon poke bowl!

IKQl454gFRQCyHXRTO3pfw.text: I guess I'm a poke snob but I didn't care for their poke. If you really want good poke in PGH go to Kahuna in East Liberty.   The protein portions here were very small and tasted somewhat watery.  The plastic utensils were bottom of the barrel quality and there weren't any napkins in the bin.

n_w5JvvSdD710DpO2NOf9Q.text: I've surprisingly never had Poke before. This is a line assembly concept similar to subway or chipotle for poke. The inside is a little unorganized but most people here just grab and go.   My sister took me here right at the tail of the lunch rush so they ran out of tuna. But I had a bowl with salmon and spicy tuna. They also serve sushi burritos! This is a standard fare and I got exactly what I expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Ir5yMKl5igGpCej84NLY3Q.text: My first experience with poke was in Hawaii. It was a magical, new food that I found myself searching for all over the islands. Never did I ever think that there would be something like that here in Pittsburgh!  This spot is definitely legit! They have so many different seafood options including tuna, salmon, shrimp, roe, spicy tuna...and it's all very fresh. You can choose several different options for your bowl. They have white and brown rice, quinoa, or a field greens base. Then you add all of the toppings that you want. Choose your Seafood choose all sorts of veggies, and different toppings like seaweed salad, sliced jalapenos, mangos, masago, etc. Top it all off with one of their house made poke sauces. Also be sure to get some of the spicy mayo on the side or drizzled on the top of your bowl.  I also believe that they're going to have hot bowls in the near future. I believe something along the lines of Korean bibimbap. I can't wait to try that!  I don't get downtown too often, but when I do this is I stopped I always make.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Double tuna poke bowl

OWyx6mRtpoZ8ZeIAFJvzEg.text: Elevator Review: Fast. Friendly. Delicious.   Pittsburgh Poke has become one of my favorite places for lunch while downtown. I have had both the sushi "burrito" and the bowls - both are fantastic and a great price.   The options for toppings are first rate. They don't skimp on anything and don't upcharge you for certain toppings.   All in all Pittsburgh Poke is delicious food at a great price.  I should also mention: don't let the long line dissuade you. The folks behind the counter move really quickly.

rgxK5sDx6a8y3LODUfhW0Q.text: My prayers have been answered! I thought only "trendy" cliche cities like NYC or LA would have poke bowl/sushi burrito places, but when I found out that this little hole in the wall existed, right in the center of downtown PGH, and a mere 800 ft from my apartment, I was jumping with joy! The establishment isn't anything fancy, just a grab-n-go place set up like a Subway or Chipotle.   First, you choose your base- white rice/brown rice/quinoa/mixed greens, then pick your protein-seared or spicy tuna, salmon, seared salmon, tofu or chicken, then veggies, sauces and toppings. Overall, extremely filling! A great post workout meal with all the protein.   I've only been there twice, but my favorite is the salmon and seared tuna with quinoa/mixed greens base, with cucumber, red cabbage, mango, cilantro, avocado, red onion, seaweed salad, fried onions, house spicy miso with spicy mayo and nori flakes. Have yet to try the sushi burrito but will save that for a day I can afford to binge on carbs ;).   I suggested that they start a frequent customer punchcard for those who eat here frequently (like I know I will be!). Hopefully they do something like that soon, with it being $12-$13 a bowl.   Thanks Pittsburgh Poke, for existing!

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KjaLwqvk52VfXzOqp0_AXQ.text: I've heard that some people have avoided this place because of the lack of curb appeal. Don't make that mistake! Their fish is easily the freshest I've had in a while, and I really like the Subway/Chipotle approach that others have mentioned - I get exactly what I want and I've never gotten a side eye or comment when I ask for extra extra of anything, nor am I ever charged extra. This place is definitely worth the few bucks extra than you would pay for your average (price and quality) lunch.

fIeUBXNYliyy4DZgERfv8g.text: I stopped by Pittsburgh Poke the day it opened because I have been waiting for a poke bowl restaurant to come to the area for quite some time now. I was so pleased to walk in and be greeted by an extremely friendly staff. They were knowledgeable and happy to explain the way the restaurant works. It is essentially a big food bar where you can choose your base for the bowl (quinoa, brown rice, mixed greens among the options) up to three proteins, and an unlimited number of fix-ins and sauces. I chose tuna and salmon with a healthy number of fix-ins and the sweet wasabi sauce. It was fresh and so delicious- exactly what I was hoping for! And when I got to the register the huge bowl was only $5. They were running a half off special for opening week and it was truly a steal. I will absolutely be back to try more combinations and the location is perhaps dangerously close to my work place... oh well! Well done Pittsburgh Poke!

iX6IbTjcJk3pbm6U9cXjuw.text: Outstanding! I went twice the first week it was open. The ingredients are fresh and the range of choices is awesome. I personally find the portion size to be perfect for lunch; I was not over-full but I didn't get hungry again before 5 either. I got a base of "half and half" (you pick two) mixed organic greens and brown rice, salmon and tuna as my protein, and loaded it up with avocado (no up-charge (!)), green onions, radishes, cucumber, crunchy (fried) onion bits, masago, and nori flakes. There are so many sauces but one of the workers behind the counter kindly walked me through all of them and offered to put the house poke on the side for me because I didn't want to make my bowl over-sweet (I am a salt monster). He gave me spicy mayo on the side, too. The combo was heavenly but I will continue to get the poke sauce on the side, since it is quite sweet and I added only about a fourth of what I think they would put on directly. At half-off my bowl rang in at $5.88, so it will be almost $12 next week and onward, but I loved it so much I'll still be back often.

_EXVFQLrYDVgqeQAhZgbyQ.text: Loved this place so much I ate there two days in a row their opening week. I've had both the poke bowl and the sushi burrito. I recommend both. The staff are all very nice and helpful if you have any questions. Definitely will be frequenting this place for lunch.

EtK_YsGiI_4Sc4AZbcZYHQ.text: I have never posted on yelp, but I felt so truly shaken by my latest experience here that I felt I should. I live 2 minutes from Pittsburgh Poke and go there at least once a week. Just today, I was in line for a sushi burrito and felt sick. I felt so sick I had to rush to the bathroom because I almost passed out. Once I came back up, I apologized and tried to order food. The owner refused to serve me saying I was already sick and he would not let me order food. I tried to explain I hadn't eaten which is what caused me to get sick and I was trying to get it to go. The owner still refused and told me to leave. I told him I would not be back and he said, fine, he did not care. I am a diligent customer, eating there on a weekly basis. I can't understand why he would be so rude to me? I have even referred other people to eat there. I cannot give my money to someone who would be so rude and disrespectful. With that being said, I walked to Bae Bae's Kitchen where they are always very kind and sweet to me. And I definitely will not be back to Pittsburgh Poke.

RkMMjqqgTb_TY6T1dUYd4Q.text: Found this place from the hot and new listing so I decide to give it a try. I got three choice of protein for 6.99 when they were offering half price for a limited time. When I walked in, it look very clean and few table to you to eat in. It look like Qubata style where you start by telling them what base do you want, then choice of protein(they do offer vegetarian choice) sides and topping and then dressing. Even it was my first time going there, it was very easy to make my choice just following their instructions on the counter. All the ingredients look clean and fresh, all the staff was very nice and friendly. They answer my questions and make recommendations base on popularity. It tasted super good and I was very happy about giving this place a try especially when it was half off! What could go wrong with that right?! The portion was huge maybe because I had three protein( spicy tuna, salmon and kini salad). Would definitely go back and already recommending this place to my friends!! Yummm

r7CjispM85hlL_F7t8h1Pg.text: I had a great meal here and was happy they carried ito en chilled green tea. Even though the AC did not work the food tasted great and the staff was very friendly. I came from the south hills and parked in the nearby parking garage for $5 the hour we were there.

8DZ6YTBUnxEKYQ9GqL--og.text: My daughter and I found this place online,  and wanted to try it before a Pens game. I'll admit when we saw the storefront,  we paused and seriously considered turning around. Feeling adventurous,  and trusting other reviews,  we went in!  What a great concept! Very fresh!  It's definitely a diamond in the rough!  If I worked downtown,  this would be my lunch every day!!!

KHAR8Kd0eluDlX98TwWJTg.text: Word of mouth travels fast; quality Asian cuisine and speedy service, even when the line is super long. The salmon and tofu are both very good. The made to order sushi rolls are a great luxury to have in the business district. Reasonable prices and friendly staff.

XNUfdZVDn1_yZzb8Wwtp6g.text: Can't believe I haven't been here sooner! Super fresh food, friendly and helpful service, and a decent amount of food for $12.

Q-6sMVdiaEb7xtcKfKlyJw.text: Went to Pittsburgh Poke with some coworkers our lunch break! I absolutely love the food. Everything is right in front of you and so fresh. I love all of the options they provide so it tailors to people who want to cut carbs. The employees are friendly and very accommodating. Only thing is that the decor and atmosphere is a little "drab" and "blah". Overall, I highly recommend and will be coming back!

FvF8ZFI57WXboo4gqoB6xw.text: I ordered the sushi burrito and it's okay. It's a dollar or two more than I would like considering the portion size, not to say the portion size was small, but not 11 plus tax. The burrito is the way to go. The poke bowls looked small. I'm glad that Pittsburgh continues to diversify its Food scene and with restaurants like this there is hope. Though I think it's more a 3.5 out of 5 than a 3, I. Can't give it a 4, because of the portion size in relation to price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pittsburgh Poke - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi burrito vs poke bowl.

6WJsnM6UvX0L6SUAENXHxQ.text: This place is amazing.  The food is fresh and delicious, the portions are generous for the price, and everyone is super nice.  There are so many add in options that you can get a different bowl with different flavors every time.  I like tuna, salmon, seaweed, roe, edamame.  No limits on toppings.   New favorite lunch spot downtown.  I hope this place survives.

55M5wH7CrU16YYNBjBookw.text: Food was great/fresh.  The building inside just feels dirty/dingy and there was an employee's kid hacking up a lung behind the counter, not the most appetizing environment to consume raw fish.

Z5LBNX5E6sFxHploVipNZg.text: Stopped in to grab something to eat on the way home. It was incredibly good!! They definitely take the "rice bowl" to the next level. I loved the ginger sesame sauce.

VSDnjGccr5FyE9jvpRvFGA.text: We have a Slack channel at the office called #hungry - and it was buzzing when this place opened.  I finally got the chance to try it, and it was even better than I had hoped.  It's really an assembly line of build-your-own (yes, like Chipotle).  The tuna tasted very fresh and was being brought out every few minutes from the back, seemingly cut in smaller batches as needed to avoid having a bunch sitting out at once.  Toppings were nicely diverse and delicious - a nice heap of scallions, avocado, edamame, and even wakame salad, which was awesome.  I'm going to have to go back to try some different combinations and sauces.  If I had one adjustment - the rice was a bit heavily seasoned with vinegar and sugar - but that won't stop me from going back quite a few times.

yesJftKdkcyOSVyMyTnAsw.text: Very very good and reasonably priced for amount and quality of the food. I got a poke bowl with two proteins + a plethora of toppings. There was A LOT of fish, and the ratio of rice to fish to toppings was perfect. All of the ingredients looked and tasted as fresh as it gets. I can't speak firsthand about the physical location or service because a friend picked it up, but he said that his experience was excellent. Employees were continually bringing out fresh fish and ingredients while he was there, so it was apparent that everything didn't just sit there in a heap all day.   Will return and recommend!

zDXHcPi8Eq3bpQmUJ26L0Q.text: Pittsburgh Poke is a fantastic addition to the Market Square area of downtown.  The fish is all super fresh and delicious and the sauces are yummy! Highly recommend the spicy tuna and the house poke sauce.  The portions are generous and the prices are fair - can't wait to come back!!

oLgklXfZEPflYN8A3bk0OQ.text: Average to slightly below average quality ingredients. I would rather go to No. 1 Sushi one block away instead. I ordered a sushi burrito with two proteins. Wasn't crazy about it.

ndNhVZ809ReArrLRmtprMA.text: Good and nice portions but don't get the shrimp. They aren't properly cleaned. I ended up discarding half the shrimp in my bowl because they still had the vein in. Gross.

php17rwt9hwdmTyLtSgicg.text: The sushi burritos were delicious and the staff was very friendly. The prices were also pretty fair for the quality. The restaurant was clean and the atmosphere was OK but not the most attractive or comfortable seating.

idCi7qSpeE71M9LoFtOHSA.text: I eat here twice per week.  It's some of the best sushi I've had in Pittsburgh and the portions are equal to around 2 full sushi rolls.  You can't beat that for $12.00.  The house poke sauce is amazing.  Absolutely recommended!!!!

mghGUN-Lh8syPYHo67EM5g.text: Incredible! So fresh and fast. I love that you can get whatever toppings and proteins you want- i.e. that it's customizable to you and your preferences. Decent price for the amount of delicious food they give you. Definitely going to make this one of my new regular places!
